data.title: Sigma Phi Epsilon
data.text:
Sigma Phi Epsilon Quick Facts

Location1047 Campus DriveNational FoundingRichmond College, November 1, 1901Chapter Founding1985ColorsRed, Purple, GoldNational PhilanthropyBig Brothers Big SistersOpen MottoBuilding Balanced MenMembership81PresidentKapil DheeriyaRecruitment ChairJoseph Machado, Anthony Sausedo, Akshana DassanaikeAdvisorRyan DennySocial MediaInstagram | Chapter | National

About Us

Stanford SigEp is first and foremost a community. A community that aims to add to standard notions of Greek life by offering a space where members of every background or identity can find a home. At SigEp, we prioritize balance in every area of life. From professional development opportunities to high-energy social events, there is a place for everyone within our organization. SigEp is more than just a group of peopleâ€”we are a tight-knit community that fosters lifelong friendships through shared experiences like our recent cabin trip to Lake Tahoe. We strongly believe that one can exist in an active social arena at no cost to their roles outside of SigEp. As a community, we constantly push ourselves to excel socially, professionally, and within the broader Stanford community through a culture that upholds key values such as accountability, trust, and most importantly: balance.

Average Quarterly Dues: $500 (Financial Aid Available)
